poem:
**Milk & Serial**

Under a flickering bulb,
a carton tipped, 
pours sorrow into the morning—
cold whispers in cereal crunch—
shadows dance in a liquid script,
on a kitchen linoleum stage.
Horrors find home,
in mundane echoes,
while digital ghosts 
find life, 
in found footage—
misery made,
for a song,
for a screen,
for us.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Milk & Serial: the vicious, viral $800-budget horror that’s free to watch 2024 is already becoming something of a banner year for horror, with Longlegs making over $100m and Late Night with the Devil earning a whopping 97% rating on Rotten Tomatoes. And yet the breakout horror of the year might just be an $800 project currently available to watch free on YouTube. Milk & Serial is a 62-minute, found-footage horror by YouTuber Curry Barker,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
